definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: A prosecutor assigned to the courtroom handled most of the routine appearances and arraignments that were paraded through each day.
sentences.chinese: 一個公訴人一天會被分配到很多例行的開庭和傳訊。

sentences.english: The prosecution alleged that the accused was in the house when the crime was committing.
sentences.chinese: 公訴人公訴方聲稱，當犯罪發生時，被告在住宅內。

sentences.english: The prosecution alleged that the accused be In the house when the crime be commit .
sentences.chinese: 公訴人公訴方聲稱，當犯罪發生時，被告在住宅內。

sentences.english: Then the prosecutor begins the most critical part of the trial.
sentences.chinese: 公訴人然後開始庭審的最關鍵部分，即傳喚證人。

sentences.english: The prosecutor in the case was recently disbar red and given a day in jail.
sentences.chinese: 該案的公訴人近期被取消了律師資格並被判入獄一天。

sentences.english: The attorney general will prosecute in trial for serious crime.
sentences.chinese: 首席檢查官將在嚴重犯罪案的審判中作公訴人。

sentences.english: Lawyers from the CPS may act as public prosecutors.
sentences.chinese: 皇家檢察署的律師擔當公訴人。

sentences.english: The prosecutor’s role ends when he gives a closing argument at the completion of a trial.
sentences.chinese: 公訴人的作用到他在庭審結束時作結案陳詞後即終止。

sentences.english: Prosecutors believe that Hong suspected of committing the crime of homicide.
sentences.chinese: 公訴人認爲，張紅涉嫌故意殺人罪。

sentences.english: Prosecutor is to read a 73-page indictment.
sentences.chinese: 公訴人正在宣讀一份長達73頁的起訴書。

sentences.english: It reports sub-standard products to the public prosecutor and health authorities.
sentences.chinese: 它將標準以下的產品報告給公訴人和健康機構。
